Html:
Hello,

I'm making a worksheet with various formatting and borders, but I need the default border for the worksheet to be blank/none. I've tried a few methods (range A:K, A1:K10000, and getDefaultStyle()->getBorders()->getAllBorders()->setBorderStyle(PHPExcel_Style_Border::BORDER_NONE)) but all of those resulted in errors. Can anyone tell me the proper way to have all cells default to no border?

 

Thanks,

-Blake

It sounds like you want to hide grid lines:

$objWorksheet->setShowGridlines(false);

Turns out that Mac's "Numbers" app was to blame. After opening it in Excel rather than Numbers, it came out the way I needed it to when printing. For some reason Numbers chooses to print gridlines by default unless you specifically mark them as white. Thanks for the help.

 

-Blake
